Dear families,

I cannot begin to imagine the emotions we each feel in this moment (or those leading to this time), but what I can do is confirm our commitment to you and the ideals we strive for as a school community. We cannot remain silent. As a school community, we are here for each other, and more than ever we need to reach out to our friends and neighbors and show the compassion, empathy, and humanity everyone deserves.

I should be clear that hatred and racism have no home at our school. Bigotry, bullying, or discrimination will not be tolerated. We treasure and hold dear the relationships that create our unique community -- those between teacher, student, and parent, all to support students’ academic and personal growth.

For students who want and need additional support at this time, I encourage you to reach out to your school counselor.

Sincerely,
Erin Taylor, School Leader

Hello, Newly Enrolled Families!
We are excited you are here, and we know you probably have tons of questions, like...

When are my materials coming? Who are my student's teachers? What's the scheduler? How many planners do I have? How is attendance taken? What is a live lesson like, and how do we find them?

The answers to these questions, and many more, can be found by attending The Learning Coach Success Series On-Boarding Sessions! We have 6 different sessions to choose from this year:

Getting Ready: Preparing for the First Day
First Days - Elementary School
First Days - Middle School
First Days - High School
Beyond the First Days: Tips for Success
Open Q&A Session

All the Learning Coach Success Sessions are being shown in the live lesson format through Learning Coach Central this year. In case you missed it, there is a direct link on your Learning Coach Homepage. Click on the link called Learning Coach Central, which can be found on the left side of your homepage, almost at the bottom of the page, and check it out!
